content: As title. Are there any specific preconditions to adding a priority/nomination label, must X people agree on it, ...

Labels can be added and changed at any time. I personally leave room for discussions to accomodate different timezones and schedules.
When we get closer to the week's meeting (like now) I try having all (or most) issues with a priority label so if by this time two or more people (getting the context right) agree I think it's fine.
my usual take is if we have 2 or more people giving an opinion and on an agreement on something let's label the issue
people that do disagree can comment and we can re-adjust
feel also free to label an issue and add a comment saying, labelling as "P-medium" for now, feel free to disagree and we can adjust the label

Santiago Pastorino said:

feel also free to label an issue and add a comment saying, labelling as "P-medium" for now, feel free to disagree and we can adjust the label

Yes, I sometimes do that
